name: National Patients' Organisation - Bulgaria
goal:
Our vision for the future is a patient-centered healthcare system where patients’ rights are developed and affirmed. We also envision equal access to high quality healthcare for all citizens.

We aim at affirmation of strong united patients’ movement on regional and national level with a visible participation on every level of the healthcare system. We nurture empowered patient community that is seen as key factor by all stakeholders in public systems at the development of health policies. We strive for patient and stakeholder awareness about the rights and the obligations of the patients.

NPO has a strong profile in advocacy and institutional collaboration as it leads the Secretariat of the permanent consultative body to the Council of Ministers in Bulgaria.

The main objectives set out in the statutes of the National Patients’ Organization are meant to carry out activities in interest of the society:

1. PATIENT INVOLVEMENT :
To develop and strengthen meaningful patient/citizen participation and involvement in management and control of the healthcare system. To engage representatives of patients in the management structures within the healthcare system.

2. EQUAL TRIPARTITE PARTNERSHIP:
To introduce the principle of equal tripartite partnership between government bodies, organizations of medical professionals and patients' associations in developing and adopting strategies, criteria and standards, policies and practices in the healthcare system.

3. SUSTAINABLE PATIENTS' ORGANISATIONS
To develop, introduce and strengthen the ethical norms and rules in the work of patients’ organizations, and their interaction with institutions, media and society. To support the development, growth and capacity building of inclusive, effective, sustainable and representative patients’ organizations, and to foster cooperation and synergies between them.

4. HEALTH LITERACY AND AWARENESS
To deliver education for patients (and caregivers) and ensure access to information in order to raise the awareness of their condition and allow them to make informed choices for self-management of their health.

5. PATIENT EMPOWERMENT
To promote development and implementation of policies, strategies and healthcare services that empower patients to be involved in the decision-making and management of their condition according to their preference, whilst raising awareness about their rights and responsibilities.

6. HEALTHCARE ACCESS AND QUALITY
To contribute to improvements in health systems in order to enable equitable access to sustainable and high-quality healthcare designed and delivered to meet the needs of the patients and their informal carers at all levels of care, embracing innovation in all its forms.

7. PUBLIC ENGAGEMENT
Raise the awareness and the commitment of the society and the institutions;

8. ANTI-STIGMATIZATION
To promote the development of national policies, that tackle discrimination faced by patients in health and social care as well as in domains like education and employment.
